page.title: 03Shopping survey of Cranbrook
page.content: Cranbrook has always been an important centre for trading . A market was originally founded in the 13th Century, and although no longer in existence , the town boasts a wide variety of shops for its size . A survey revealed that most people in Cranbrook found shopping convenient and easy despite prices for most goods being cheaper elsewhere . The International and Liptons are popular shops as are sweet shops , veg shops , and newsagents . With a wide variety of shops trade is good . The clothes shops and shoe shops tend not to sell many fashions for young people and the gift shops although selling nice gifts are rather expensive . Recently a number of farm shops have opened outside Cranbrook.Although some prices are high traders realise that they have to compete with the larger towns especially Maidstone and T.Wells
